newsitem.title: UK: British retail sales fall in July.
newsitem.headline: British retail sales fall in July.

text.p: British retail sales fell 0.6 percent in July after a bumper 1.4 percent rise in June, data from the Office for National Statistics showed.
Economists said the figures would give Chancellor of the Exchequer Kenneth Clarke further ammunition if he wants to cut 5.75 percent base lending rates again.
